thread.title: Two Forks and Creamline Opening Soon, a Gold Pizza Knock-Off, a Magic Mushroom Latte, and Other Intel
thread.title_full: Two Forks and Creamline Opening Soon, a Gold Pizza Knock-Off, a Magic Mushroom Latte, and Other Intel

author: Melissa McCart
title: Two Forks and Creamline Opening Soon, a Gold Pizza Knock-Off, a Magic Mushroom Latte, and Other Intel

organizations.name: southern restaurant printers alley in times square

text:
Danny Meyer is not opening at 28 Liberty St., another Poke Spot, plus more NYC news 
—Joining Brooklyn Brewery , Russ & Daughters , and Mast Brothers at Brooklyn Navy Yard, Bed-Stuy Haitian spot Grandchamps will serve breakfast and lunch and Rustik Tavern , open since 2008 in Bed-Stuy/Clinton Hill, will serve comfort food. Also look for Smorgasburg vendor, We Rub You and Crown Heights Caribbean spot, The Food Sermon among others, DNAinfo reports . Brooklyn Navy Yard is on track to open in stages, starting mid-2017, part of the $185 million revitalization of Building 77. 
— Two Forks is opening in mid-January at 114 W. 41st St., a fast-casual spot from HPH Hospitality Group (behind Financial District spots like Harry’s Italian , The Dead Rabbit , and Ulysses ) with chef Michael Kaplan and David Oz, a partner in Bathtub Gin in Chelsea, at the helm. The Two Forks menu will showcase “slow-cooked meats with seasonal slaws and globally inspired sauces.”
— Creamline opens Jan. 18 at 180 7th Ave., the stand-alone location of the Chelsea Market spot. Harris Mayer-Selinger will offer comfort food favorites, all-day breakfast, fried Oreos, milkshakes, and soft-serve. 
— There’s been new talk that Danny Meyer may be opening a public-facing restaurant on the 60th floor of 28 Liberty St., with the Post reporting it as a potential events space last year. A spokesperson for the Union Square Hospitality Group says that the team still hasn't signed a contract with the property managers and there's been no talk of a new restaurant. "It's not in the cards right now," she says.
— Here’s a copycat of the $ 2000 gold-layered pizza made by Industry Kitchen in the Financial District. From Pasquale Cozzolino, of Ribalta in Greenwich Village, the Oro Nero features buffalo mozzarella, a runny egg, dollops of black caviar, black truffle shavings, bottarga, and “white truffle gold dust.” The concoction is $20, today only. 
— Korean-Japanese spot — which also offers karaoke— Sandobe is now open in Bed-Stuy.
— Radiance water, magic mushroom latte, anxiety-busting hot cocoa latte: all drinks at The End, the Williamsburg cafe that also sells the $9 unicorn latte. 
— No deal for Jimmy Buffett’s Margaritaville. “ It’s back to square one .”
— Tavern on Jane proprietor, Michael Stewart will be opening a 50+ seat restaurant in the former Redhead space. And it’s looking like The Poke Spot is opening another location at 25 Cleveland Place in Little Italy. 
— The Blue Blazer: “ the preppiest drink of all time .”
— Page Six sightings: Charles Esten of ABC’s “Nashville,” at season premiere watch party at new Southern restaurant Printers Alley in Times Square; LeBron James with a group of friends at Quality Italian and Snooki with a large group at Scott Conant's Impero Caffè at the Innside NoMad hotel.
— For your morning consumption, a refresher on how we got to third-wave coffee.
